ci_support_linux_64_python3.10.____cpyth:
c_compiler:
- gcc
c_compiler_version:
- '14'
c_stdlib:
- sysroot
c_stdlib_version:
- '2.17'
channel_sources:
- conda-forge
channel_targets:
- conda-forge main
cxx_compiler:
- gxx
cxx_compiler_version:
- '14'
docker_image:
- quay.io/condaforge/linux-anvil-x86_64:alma9
fortran_compiler:
- gfortran
fortran_compiler_version:
- '14'
hdf5:
- 1.14.6
libaec:
- '1'
libcurl:
- '8'
libscotch:
- 7.0.11
metis:
- 5.1.0
mkl:
- '2025'
mkl_devel:
- '2025'
openmpi:
- '5'
openssl:
- '3.5'
pin_run_as_build:
  python:
    min_pin: x.x
    max_pin: x.x
python:
- 3.10.* *_cpython
target_platform:
- linux-64
tk:
- '8.6'
zip_keys:
- - c_compiler_version
  - cxx_compiler_version
  - fortran_compiler_version
zlib:
- '1'

about.description:
OpenSees is a software framework for developing applications
 to simulate the performance of structural and geotechnical systems
 subjected to earthquakes.
 The goal of the OpenSees development is to improve the modeling
 and computational simulation in earthquake engineering
 through open-source development.
 The development of OpenSees was sponsored by
 the Pacific Earthquake Engineering Research Center.
about.summary: Simulate the performance of structural and geotechnical systems subjected to earthquakes

about.description:
OpenSees is a software framework for developing applications
 to simulate the performance of structural and geotechnical systems
 subjected to earthquakes.
 The goal of the OpenSees development is to improve the modeling
 and computational simulation in earthquake engineering
 through open-source development.
 The development of OpenSees was sponsored by
 the Pacific Earthquake Engineering Research Center.
about.summary: Simulate the performance of structural and geotechnical systems subjected to earthquakes

name: opensees
raw_meta_yaml:
{% set name = "OpenSees" %}
{% set version = "3.8.0" %}

package:
  name: {{ name|lower }}
  version: {{ version }}

source:
  url: https://github.com/OpenSees/OpenSees/archive/refs/tags/v{{ version }}.tar.gz
  sha256: 395d89f97ad0fe2a857e31b045c96badf23ad19ba8ce38f21c5a5d7891091810

build:
  skip: true  # [not linux]
  number: 0

requirements:
  build:
    - {{ compiler('c') }}
    - {{ compiler('cxx') }}
    - {{ compiler('fortran') }}
    - {{ stdlib('c') }}
    - cmake
    - make
    - openmpi
  host:
    - python
    - pip
    - setuptools
    - mumps
    - eigen
    - hdf5
    - openmpi
    - scalapack
    - tk
    - mysql
    - zlib
    - mkl
    - mkl-include
    - mkl-devel
    - metis
    - libscotch
    - libaec
    - libcurl
    - openssl
  run:
    - scalapack
    - python
    - mkl

test:
  commands:
    - test -f $PREFIX/bin/OpenSees  # [unix]

  imports:
    - opensees

about:
  home: https://opensees.berkeley.edu/
  summary: 'Simulate the performance of structural and geotechnical systems subjected to earthquakes'
  description: |
    OpenSees is a software framework for developing applications
     to simulate the performance of structural and geotechnical systems 
     subjected to earthquakes. 
     The goal of the OpenSees development is to improve the modeling 
     and computational simulation in earthquake engineering 
     through open-source development.
     The development of OpenSees was sponsored by 
     the Pacific Earthquake Engineering Research Center.
  license: BSD-4-Clause-UC
  license_family: BSD
  license_file: COPYRIGHT
  doc_url: https://opensees.github.io/OpenSeesDocumentation/
  dev_url: https://github.com/OpenSees/OpenSees

extra:
  recipe-maintainers:
    - ldallolio
